abstract: In this Corner Office spoof, the fictional C.E.O. of The Onion says goals are for soccer players, not for bosses.
snippet: In this Corner Office spoof, the fictional C.E.O. of The Onion says goals are for soccer players, not for bosses.
lead_paragraph: Corner Office asked a writer at The Onion to imagine, with tongue firmly in cheek, an interview on leadership and management with the company’s fictional C.E.O., T. Herman Zweibel. According to Onion legend, the Zweibels founded the company in 1765 or 1988 or some other year, in the belief that their publication should always be a one-way conduit of information — and that if not for the almighty greenback and the interests of advertisers, it would not be necessary to have readers — riff-raff — at all.

headline.main: Make ’Em Toe the Line (if They Can Find It)
headline.print_headline: Make ’Em Toe the Line (if They Can Find It)
